abstracts.cdata!:
The project outcome is satisfactory,
            sustainability highly likely, with substantial institutional
            development impacts. Nonetheless, lessons underline the need
            for coordination among the various government entities, and
            agencies. Despite The National Bank of Ukraine (NBU)
            demonstrating its ability to take responsibility in
            organizing, and managing most dimensions of a complex,
            multi-component adjustment operation in the financial
            sector, the project however, also revealed the poor quality
            of coordination between NBU, and other key government
            agencies. The absence of a unified vision on what financial
            sector reform is meant to achieve, led to wasted, project
            implementation efforts, where actions promoted by one part
            of the Administration, hindered the intentions of other
            government entities. Such results, and the obvious need for
            an integrated government approach that ensures the benefits
            of economic reforms, promoted the implementation of a new
            inter-agency, the Financial Sector Policy Board, established
            at the end of the year 2000.
